Reviews.Title: Poor Performance
Reviews.Author: Rotimi
Reviews.Content: I have this camera and was disappointed at its performance. It works well in direct line and less than 50 feet from the receiver, after which its quality deteriorates fast. Though its rated @ 300 ft, I could not get a picture @ more than 50 ft and even poorer picture with a lot of flickering @ more than 12 ft. For instance, I cannot use the camera from my attached garage, and no unusual obstacle in between. The accompanying power cable is too short to allow flexibity in location but you can buy an extention cable. Also, I still can't get the auto vcr recording to work. Night vision is poor, color is not so great.However, If you will be using it close to the receiver, its an excellent security camera for its price under $100.00. I like the trigger feature that beeps whenever a movement is detected.By and large if you know its limitations and are imaginative its  not a bad device to have. I am planning to get more around my house as the receiver can handle 4 cameras but I can't get to buy an isolated camera without another receiver. I don't know if its compatible with other 2.4ghz cameras.

Reviews.Title: fuzzy at first then not even that!
Reviews.Author: defective camera
Reviews.Content: I had two other cameras like this one that vandals had destroyed but this one didnt work right out of the box. can I send it back and get a new one. now the other two worked just fine but not this one. Fred Eddleman

Reviews.Title: Don't Use With 2.4ghz Phones!
Reviews.Author: Misterdoo
Reviews.Content: I just received this item and found out that my 2.4ghz phone system totally interferes with it. Not a winning combination. The range is not terrible WITHOUT the phone base stations plugged in.

ProductInfo.Features:
Built-in high resolution CMOS sensor
Power on LED indicator
Built-in microphone
PIR to detect movement
Transmits up to 300-feet in open space
ProductInfo.Name: Homeland Security 850 Motion Activated Color Cam with Remote VCR Activation
